Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Carrageenan \Car`ra*geen"an\, Carrigeenin \Car`ri*geen"in\, n. a colloidal material obtained from seaweed or Irish moss, used as an thickening or emulsifying agent and for stabilizing foods, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals. [PJC] ||
carrageenan n : a colloidal extract from carrageen seaweed and other red algae [syn: {carrageenin}]
